abstract.text: Declare the user interface and behavior for your app on every platform.
Content within an accessibility rotor.
Display large numbers of repeated views efficiently with scroll views, stack
views, and lazy stacks.
Visualize collections of data with platform-appropriate appearance.
A type of table row content that generates table rows from an underlying
collection of data.
A type of view that generates views from an underlying collection of data.
An environment-dependent font.
A structure that computes views on demand from an underlying collection of
identified data.
A function to create content on demand using the underlying data.
The collection of underlying identified data that SwiftUI uses to create
views dynamically.
Creates an instance that uniquely identifies and creates table rows
across updates based on the identity of the underlying data.
Creates an instance that uniquely identifies and creates map content
across updates based on the identity of the underlying data.
Creates an instance that uniquely identifies and creates views across
updates based on the identity of the underlying data.
Creates an instance that uniquely identifies and creates map content
across updates based on the provided key path to the underlying dataâ€™s
identifier.
Creates an instance that uniquely identifies and creates views across
updates based on the identity of the underlying data.
Creates an instance that uniquely identifies and creates views across
updates based on the sections of a given view.
Creates an instance that uniquely identifies and creates views across
updates based on the subviews of a given view.
A collection which allows a view to be treated as a collection of its
sections in a for each loop.
A collection which allows a view to be treated as a collection of its
subviews in a for each loop.
Split content into logical sections inside lazy stack views.

abstract.text: A view that arranges its subviews in a horizontal line.
A view that arranges its children in a line that grows vertically,
creating items only as needed.
A container that presents rows of data arranged in a single column,
optionally providing the ability to select one or more members.
Build flexible user interfaces by using stacks, grids, lists, and forms.

abstract.text: A type that provides content for programmatically selectable tabs in a
tab view.
A type used to represent table rows.
A view that displays one or more lines of read-only text.
A view that arranges its subviews in a vertical line.
A type that represents part of your appâ€™s user interface and provides
modifiers that you use to configure views.
A view that overlays its subviews, aligning them in both axes.
A class of types whose instances hold the value of an entity with stable identity.
A collection that supports efficient random-access index traversal.
A Â type of view that generates views from an underlying collection of data.
A protocol used to construct map content such as controls, markers, and annotations.
A type that provides content for an attachment content builder.
A type that represents the content that you draw on a chart.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A collection that supports efficient random-access index traversal.
A type whose values can be implicitly or explicitly copied.
